docs.title: About
docs.text: Future Makers is the open source course kit for STEAM education.

docs.title: STEAM Course Teacher Handbook
docs.text: Welcome to the STEAM Course Teacher Handbook. This comprehensive guide provides everything you need to successfully deliver STEAM courses.

docs.title: Git Intxroduction
docs.text:
• What is Git?
  • Git is a free and open-source source control management (SCM) system.
  • It is a distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code.

  • Git's primary function is to track changes to files over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and compare differences.

  • Why Use Git?

  • Manage changes to files: Git allows you to see who changed what and compare different versions.
  • Revert to previous versions: If you make a mistake, you can jump back to a previous version.
  • Experiment safely: Use branches to work on new features or fixes without affecting the main code.
  • Track project history: Git keeps a record of all changes made, creating a project history.
  • Key Git Concepts
  • Repository (Repo): A storage location for source code, documentation, and other files with all its history. Represented by the hidden .git folder.
  • Commit: A snapshot of a repository at a specific point in time, creating a record of changes made.
  • Branch: A parallel version of a project's code, allowing developers to work on features or fixes without affecting the main code.
  • Staging: A transitional area where changes are prepared to be included in the next commit.
  • Working Directory: The area where you make edits to your files.

docs.title: Git installation
docs.text:
• Install Git from here
  • Check if Git is installed by running git --version in the terminal

docs.title: Git commands
docs.text:
• git clone: Clone a repository from a remote source.
git clone https://github.com/beets3d/FutureMakers.git
  • git pull: Pull changes from a remote repository to your local repository. 
    git pull origin main

docs.title: Github Introduction
docs.text:
• What is GitHub?
  • GitHub is a web-based platform for version control and collaboration using Git.
  • It provides cloud hosting for Git repositories.

  • It offers tools for project management, issue tracking, and code review.

  • Key GitHub Features

  • Remote Repositories: GitHub hosts repositories that can be accessed by multiple users.
  • Collaboration: GitHub facilitates collaboration through features like issues, pull requests, and project management tools.
  • Issues: Used to track feature requests, bug reports, or questions related to a project.
  • Pull Requests: A request to merge changes from one branch into another, often used in collaborative workflows.
  • Connecting Local Git to GitHub
  • Create a Repository on GitHub: Set up a new repository on GitHub.
  • Add Remote: Connect your local repo to a remote GitHub repo with the command git remote add origin .
  • Set Main Branch: Set the target branch to main using git branch -M main.

  • Push to GitHub: Push your local repo to the remote with the command git push -u origin main. git push --all will push all branches to GitHub.

  • Working with GitHub

  • Making Changes: Edit files directly on GitHub or make changes locally and push them.
  • Downloading Changes: Use git fetch to download all the remote history or git pull to download all remote history and merge it with local files.
  • Collaboration: Use issues and pull requests to manage changes and collaborate with others.
  • Releases: Create releases to mark specific versions of your project.

docs.title: Actions
docs.text:
1. Register a Github account
  2. Git clone the FutureMakers repository to your local machine

docs.title: VSCode / Cursor
docs.text:
• VSCode
    1. VSCode is a code editor developed by Microsoft. It is a powerful and versatile tool that supports multiple programming languages and has a wide range of extensions for enhancing productivity.
    2. Download VSCode from here
  • Cursor
    1. Cursor is an AI-powered code editor developed by Cursor AI. It uses AI to assist with code writing, debugging, and refactoring. Cursor integrates with GitHub, allowing for seamless collaboration and version control.
    2. Download Cursor from here

docs.title: Clone the FutureMakers repository in Cursor
docs.text:
1. Install Cursor
  2. Register an cursor account
  3. Git clone the FutureMakers repository
  4. Open the repository in Cursor

docs.title: Markdown
docs.text:
• Markdown is a lightweight markup language with plain text formatting syntax. It is designed to be easy to read, write, and format.
  • Markdown syntax: https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/

  • Examples:

    Syntax Example # Heading # Heading **bold text** bold text *italic text* italic text [Link](URL) Link `code` code ![Beets Logo](https://beets3d.github.io/FutureMakers/assets/beets-logo-square.avif)

docs.title: Warp for VSCode / Cursor
docs.text:
• Marpit /mɑːrpɪt/ is the skinny framework for creating slide deck from Markdown. It can transform Markdown and CSS theme(s) to slide deck composed of static HTML and CSS and create a web page convertible into slide PDF by printing.
  • We can use Marpit in VSCode or Cursor to create slide deck from Markdown with a excellent editing experience. It also helps us to generate slides from Markdown in our own website.
  • Install Marpit in VSCode or Cursor: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=marp-team.marp-vscode

docs.title: Github pages and Mkdocs
docs.text:
• Github pages is a static website hosting service that allows us to host our own website for free.
  • We can use MKdocs to build our website and host it on Github pages.
  • Install MKdocs by running pip install mkdocs in the terminal
  • Run mkdocs serve to serve the website
  • Run mkdocs build to build the website. The built website will be in the site folder.

Note: - We need to install the requirements.txt file by running pip install -r requirements.txt in the terminal. - If you are using python 3.10 or above, you should make your virtual environment with python 3.10 and install the requirements.txt file in the virtual environment.

docs.title: Exercise Cards: Getting to Know Nomad Sculpt
Task
docs.text: Create a simple facial expression by modifying the base model.

docs.title: Solution Steps
docs.text:
1. Use 'SelfMask'
  2. Mask the eyes by using 'Rect' selector
  3. Use 'Move' to change the mouth
  4. Clear the mask
  5. Use 'Smooth' to remove the bumpy parts

docs.title: Handbook: Getting to Know Nomad Sculpt
Welcome to Nomad!
docs.text:
Nomad is a 3D sculpting app that works best on tablets with a pressure-sensitive stylus, such as an Apple iPad and Pencil, or a Samsung Galaxy Tab with a stylus.

Inspired by desktop sculpting apps like Zbrush and Blender, it focuses on an easy-to-understand UI without sacrificing features. If you've used 3D sculpting apps before, Nomad will feel very familiar.

docs.title: Your First Sculpt
docs.text:
When you first start Nomad, you'll see a sphere on the screen. Simply drag your stylus on the sphere to begin sculpting.

Symmetry is enabled by default to make the sculpting process easier.

docs.title: Top menus
docs.text: The menus in Nomad give you access to most of its features...

docs.title: Tips & Tricks
docs.text:
Navigation Tips

  • Use the Nav Cube for quick view changes
  • Practice the three basic gestures until they become natural
  • Remember to use two fingers for panning

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
• Nomad Sculpt Documentation
  • Keyboard Shortcuts
  • Video Tutorials

docs.title: Lesson Plan: Getting to Know Nomad Sculpt
Lesson Overview
docs.text:
• Subject: STEAM
  • Topic: Getting to Know Nomad Sculpt
  • Target: Primary Year 4 students
  • Duration: 55 minutes (5 + 25 + 15 + 10)

docs.title: Teacher Preparation
docs.text:
• Projector
  • Demonstration videos
  • Tablet with Nomad Sculpt installed
  • Electronic pen (stylus)
  • 3D model file of Moai statue
  • Game cards

docs.title: Student Materials
docs.text:
• Tablet with Nomad Sculpt installed
  • Stylus/Electronic pen
  • Exercise reference cards

docs.title: Teaching Process
docs.text:
1. Introduction (5 mins)
  2. Activities:
    • Explain that Nomad Sculpt is one of the tools available for creating 3D models through sculpting
  3. Key Statements:
    • "Using Nomad Sculpt is like playing with clay inside a tablet. You mould and shape your 3D models with your fingers, just as you would with real clay, but without the mess."

  4. Materials:

    • Play a short video (approximately 1 minute and 30 seconds) showcasing the final production to capture students' interest and inspire curiosity

  5. Development (25 mins)

  6. Activities:
    1. Control the screen perspective
    2. Get to know common sculpting tools
    3. Tune sculpting tools
    4. Restore sculpting effects
    5. File Processing and add new shape
  7. Key Points:
    • Basic interface and operation
    • Identifying the direction using the cube
    • Returning to a previous step: the new action will replace all steps after this step (cannot be restored)
    • Most sculpting tools cannot be used before you press Validate

  8. Materials:

    • Teachers can learn the operations from the demonstration videos in the teaching materials to play these videos in class

  9. Consolidation (15 mins)

  10. Exercise:
    • Follow the instructions on the game card to transform the Moai statue into different expressions or shapes
  11. Key Points:
    • Familiarize with Nomad Sculpt
    • Use sculpting tools to transform Moai statues
    • Save the file and rename it as "exercise_class_name"
    • Be mindful: If students make the model too thin or damaged (appearing orange), it cannot be 3D printed

  12. Materials:

    • Import the 3D model file of the Moai statue
    • Use game cards for further guidance

  13. Summary (10 mins)

  14. Activities:
    • Encourage students to present and share their completed projects, allowing them to demonstrate their creativity and skills
  15. Key Points:
    • Encourage students to share what their task was on the game card and explain how they achieved it
    • Foster a culture of appreciation and learning from each other's creativity and efforts
  16. Materials:
    • Projector for presentations

docs.title: Teaching Tips
docs.text:
Class Management

  • Ensure all tablets are charged and have Nomad Sculpt installed
  • Use the projector for clear demonstrations
  • Follow the prepared demonstration videos when needed
  • Monitor student progress and provide individual support
  • Keep instructions simple and clear for Year 4 level
  • Use the game cards to guide student activities
  • Encourage peer learning and sharing

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Common questions and answers about the Future Makers STEAM course kit.

docs.title: What is Future Makers?
docs.text: Future Makers is an open-source STEAM education course kit designed to help educators teach creative technology skills through hands-on projects.

docs.title: Who is this course kit for?
docs.text: This course kit is designed for educators teaching students aged 12-18, but can be adapted for other age groups.

docs.title: What equipment do we need?
docs.text:
• Tablets with Apple Pencil or similar stylus support
  • Computers for 3D modeling
  • Basic art supplies
  • Internet connection

docs.title: What software do we need?
docs.text:
• Nomad Sculpt (for 3D modeling)
  • Basic image editing software
  • Web browser for accessing online resources

docs.title: How long does each project take?
docs.text: Most projects are designed for 2-3 class periods (45-60 minutes each), but can be adjusted based on your needs.

docs.title: How do I assess student work?
docs.text: We provide detailed assessment rubrics and guidelines in our Assessment section.

docs.title: What if we don't have all the recommended equipment?
docs.text: We provide alternative approaches and modifications for different resource levels.

docs.title: Where can I get help if I'm stuck?
docs.text:
• Check our troubleshooting guide
  • Join our community forum
  • Contact our support team

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text: Essential terms and definitions for STEAM education.

docs.title: A
docs.text:
Additive Manufacturing : The process of creating objects by adding material layer by layer, commonly known as 3D printing.

Animation : The process of creating the illusion of motion by displaying a sequence of static images.

docs.title: B
docs.text:
Boolean Operations : Mathematical operations (union, difference, intersection) used to combine or subtract 3D shapes.

Brush Tool : A digital tool used for sculpting or painting in 3D software.

docs.title: M
docs.text:
Mesh : A collection of vertices, edges, and faces that define the shape of a 3D object.

Modeling : The process of creating three-dimensional representations of objects in digital space.

docs.title: P
docs.text: Project-Based Learning : An educational approach where students learn by actively engaging in real-world projects.

docs.title: S
docs.text: STEAM : Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics - an educational approach that integrates these disciplines.

docs.title: R
docs.text: Rendering : The process of generating a 2D image from a 3D scene.

docs.title: T
docs.text: Topology : The arrangement of vertices, edges, and faces in a 3D model.

docs.title: Troubleshooting Guide
docs.text: Solutions for common issues encountered in STEAM projects.

docs.title: App Crashes
docs.text:
1. Ensure your device has enough storage space
  2. Close other running applications
  3. Restart the app
  4. Update to the latest version

docs.title: Performance Issues
docs.text:
• Reduce model complexity
  • Lower brush resolution
  • Clear undo history
  • Export work regularly

docs.title: Stylus Not Working
docs.text:
1. Check battery level
  2. Restart tablet
  3. Re-pair stylus
  4. Check compatibility

docs.title: Device Running Slow
docs.text:
• Clear cache
  • Remove unused apps
  • Check storage space
  • Update system software

docs.title: Model Not Saving
docs.text:
1. Check storage space
  2. Use auto-save feature
  3. Export work regularly
  4. Keep backup copies

docs.title: Export Problems
docs.text:
• Check file format
  • Reduce model complexity
  • Clear cache
  • Update software

docs.title: Support Resources
docs.text:
• Community forum
  • Video tutorials
  • Documentation
  • Technical support contact

docs.title: When to Seek Help
docs.text:
• Persistent crashes
  • Data loss
  • Hardware failures
  • Complex technical issues

docs.title: Assessment
docs.text: This guide provides assessment strategies and rubrics for evaluating student learning in STEAM projects.

docs.title: 1. Project-Based Assessment
docs.text:
• Final project evaluation
  • Process documentation
  • Technical skills demonstration
  • Creative problem-solving

docs.title: 2. Formative Assessment
docs.text:
• Progress checkpoints
  • Peer review sessions
  • Self-reflection logs
  • Skills practice exercises

docs.title: 3. Portfolio Assessment
docs.text:
• Project documentation
  • Design iterations
  • Technical drawings
  • Final presentations

docs.title: Technical Skills (30%)
docs.text:
• Tool proficiency
  • Software usage
  • Technical accuracy
  • Safety compliance

docs.title: Creative Process (30%)
docs.text:
• Ideation
  • Design development
  • Problem-solving
  • Innovation

docs.title: Project Execution (40%)
docs.text:
• Project completion
  • Quality of work
  • Documentation
  • Presentation

docs.title: Teaching Tips
docs.text: Essential guidance for educators teaching STEAM projects.

docs.title: Setting Up Your Space
docs.text:
• Arrange workstations for collaboration
  • Ensure easy access to tools and materials
  • Create designated areas for different activities
  • Maintain clear pathways for safety

docs.title: Time Management
docs.text:
• Plan buffer time for setup and cleanup
  • Break complex tasks into manageable chunks
  • Use visual timers for activities
  • Build in time for troubleshooting

docs.title: Project Introduction
docs.text:
1. Start with engaging examples
  2. Connect to real-world applications
  3. Break down complex concepts
  4. Set clear expectations

docs.title: Supporting Student Learning
docs.text:
• Encourage peer learning
  • Provide visual aids
  • Use step-by-step demonstrations
  • Allow for hands-on exploration

docs.title: Differentiation
docs.text:
• Offer multiple entry points
  • Provide extension activities
  • Allow for different learning speeds
  • Support various learning styles

docs.title: Technical Issues
docs.text:
• Have backup plans ready
  • Prepare troubleshooting guides
  • Set up peer support systems
  • Document solutions for future reference

docs.title: Student Engagement
docs.text:
• Use real-world examples
  • Incorporate student interests
  • Create collaborative opportunities
  • Celebrate progress and achievements

docs.title: 課程資料
docs.text: 課程名稱：雙面字 年級程度：中一至中三 課時：3節課 (每節90分鐘)

docs.title: 課程概覽
docs.text: 學生將學習使用3D建模軟件創作一個雙面字。

docs.title: 快速連結
docs.text:
• 📖 指南
  • 📝 教案
  • 🎯 練習卡

docs.title: 學習目標
docs.text:
• 學習在3D界面中使用平移、旋轉和縮放進行導航
  • 學習雕刻基本形狀

docs.text: 通過修改基礎模型創建簡單的面部表情。

docs.title: 解決步驟
docs.text:
1. 使用「SelfMask」
  2. 使用「Rect」選擇器遮罩眼睛部分
  3. 使用「Move」工具改變嘴部
  4. 清除遮罩
  5. 使用「Smooth」工具去除凹凸不平的部分

  • 視頻資源包中的「Exercise_001」視頻

[... Exercise No. 002 content ...]

docs.title: 歡迎使用 Nomad！
docs.text:
Nomad 是一款 3D 雕刻應用程式，最適合配合具有壓力感應筆使用的平板電腦，例如 Apple iPad 和 Apple Pencil，或配備觸控筆的 Samsung Galaxy Tab。

受到桌面雕刻軟件如 Zbrush 和 Blender 的啟發，Nomad 專注於提供簡單易懂的使用界面，同時不犧牲功能性。如果你曾經使用過 3D 雕刻軟件，使用 Nomad 會感到非常熟悉。

docs.title: 你的第一個雕刻作品
docs.text:
當你首次啟動 Nomad 時，你會在螢幕上看到一個球體。只需用觸控筆在球體上拖曳即可開始雕刻。

預設開啟對稱功能，讓雕刻過程更容易。

docs.title: 頂部選單
docs.text: Nomad 的選單讓你可以存取大部分功能...

docs.title: 技巧與竅門
docs.text:
導航技巧

  • 使用導航立方體快速更改視角
  • 練習三個基本手勢直到熟練
  • 記住使用雙指進行平移

docs.title: 資源
docs.text:
• Nomad Sculpt 說明文件
  • 鍵盤快捷鍵
  • 影片教學

docs.title: 課程概覽
docs.text:
• 科目： STEAM
  • 主題： 認識 Nomad Sculpt
  • 對象： 小學四年級學生
  • 時長： 55分鐘 (5 + 25 + 15 + 10)

docs.title: 教師準備
docs.text:
• 投影機
  • 示範影片
  • 已安裝 Nomad Sculpt 的平板電腦
  • 電子筆（觸控筆）
  • 摩艾石像的3D模型檔案
  • 遊戲卡片

docs.title: 學生材料
docs.text:
• 已安裝 Nomad Sculpt 的平板電腦
  • 觸控筆/電子筆
  • 練習參考卡

docs.title: 教學流程
docs.text:
1. 引入 (5分鐘)
  2. 活動：
    • 說明 Nomad Sculpt 是通過雕刻創建3D模型的工具之一
  3. 重點說明：
    • 「使用 Nomad Sculpt 就像在平板電腦裡玩泥膠。你可以用手指塑造和改變3D模型，就像玩真的泥膠一樣，但不會弄得一團糟。」

  4. 材料：

    • 播放短片（約1分30秒）展示最終作品，以引起學生興趣並激發好奇心

  5. 發展 (25分鐘)

  6. 活動：
    1. 控制螢幕視角
    2. 認識常用雕刻工具
    3. 調整雕刻工具
    4. 還原雕刻效果
    5. 檔案處理及新增形狀
  7. 重點：
    • 基本界面和操作
    • 使用立方體辨認方向
    • 返回上一步：新動作將取代此步驟後的所有步驟（無法還原）
    • 大多數雕刻工具在按下確認前無法使用

  8. 材料：

    • 教師可從教材中的示範影片學習操作，在課堂上播放這些影片

  9. 鞏固 (15分鐘)

  10. 練習：
    • 按照遊戲卡片的指示將摩艾石像變成不同表情或形狀
  11. 重點：
    • 熟悉 Nomad Sculpt
    • 使用雕刻工具改變摩艾石像
    • 儲存檔案並重新命名為「exercise_班級_姓名」
    • 注意事項：如果學生把模型做得太薄或損壞（呈現橙色），將無法進行3D打印

  12. 材料：

    • 匯入摩艾石像的3D模型檔案
    • 使用遊戲卡片作為指引

  13. 總結 (10分鐘)

  14. 活動：
    • 鼓勵學生展示和分享他們完成的作品，讓他們展示創意和技巧
  15. 重點：
    • 鼓勵學生分享他們在遊戲卡片上的任務，並解釋他們是如何完成的
    • 培養欣賞和學習彼此創意和努力的文化
  16. 材料：
    • 用於展示的投影機

docs.title: 教學提示
docs.text:
課堂管理

  • 確保所有平板電腦已充電並安裝 Nomad Sculpt
  • 使用投影機進行清晰示範
  • 需要時跟隨準備好的示範影片
  • 監察學生進度並提供個別支援
  • 為四年級學生提供簡單清晰的指示
  • 使用遊戲卡片引導學生活動
  • 鼓勵同儕學習和分享

docs.title: 常見問題
docs.text: 關於Future Makers STEAM課程套件的常見問題和答案。

docs.title: 什麼是Future Makers？
docs.text: Future Makers是一個開源的STEAM教育課程套件，旨在幫助教育工作者通過動手實踐專案教授創意科技技能。

docs.title: 這個課程套件適合誰？
docs.text: 本課程套件專為教授12-18歲學生的教育工作者設計，但可以根據需要調整適用於其他年齡組。

docs.title: 我們需要什麼設備？
docs.text:
• 支援Apple Pencil或類似觸控筆的平板電腦
  • 用於3D建模的電腦
  • 基本美術用品
  • 網絡連接

docs.title: 我們需要什麼軟件？
docs.text:
• Nomad Sculpt（用於3D建模）
  • 基本圖像編輯軟件
  • 用於訪問在線資源的網絡瀏覽器

docs.title: 每個專案需要多長時間？
docs.text: 大多數專案設計為2-3節課（每節45-60分鐘），但可以根據需要調整。

docs.title: 如何評估學生的作品？
docs.text: 我們在評估部分提供詳細的評估標準和指南。

docs.title: 如果我們沒有所有推薦的設備怎麼辦？
docs.text: 我們提供適用於不同資源水平的替代方案和修改建議。

docs.title: 遇到困難時在哪裡可以獲得幫助？
docs.text:
• 查看我們的故障排除指南
  • 加入我們的社區論壇
  • 聯繫我們的支援團隊

docs.title: 詞彙表
docs.text: STEAM教育的重要術語和定義。

docs.title: A
docs.text:
增材製造 : 通過逐層添加材料創建物體的過程，通常稱為3D打印。

動畫 : 通過顯示一系列靜態圖像來創建運動錯覺的過程。

docs.title: B
docs.text:
布爾運算 : 用於組合或減去3D形狀的數學運算（聯集、差集、交集）。

筆刷工具 : 在3D軟件中用於雕刻或繪畫的數字工具。

docs.title: M
docs.text:
網格 : 定義3D物體形狀的頂點、邊和面的集合。

建模 : 在數字空間中創建物體三維表示的過程。

docs.title: P
docs.text: 專案式學習 : 學生通過積極參與實際專案進行學習的教育方法。

docs.title: S
docs.text: STEAM : 科學、技術、工程、藝術和數學 - 整合這些學科的教育方法。

docs.title: R
docs.text: 渲染 : 從3D場景生成2D圖像的過程。

docs.title: T
docs.text: 拓撲 : 3D模型中頂點、邊和面的排列。

docs.title: 故障排除指南
docs.text: STEAM專案中常見問題的解決方案。

docs.title: 應用程式崩潰
docs.text:
1. 確保設備有足夠的存儲空間
  2. 關閉其他運行中的應用程式
  3. 重新啟動應用程式
  4. 更新至最新版本

docs.title: 性能問題
docs.text:
• 降低模型複雜度
  • 降低筆刷解析度
  • 清除撤銷歷史
  • 定期導出作品

docs.title: 觸控筆不工作
docs.text:
1. 檢查電池電量
  2. 重新啟動平板電腦
  3. 重新配對觸控筆
  4. 檢查兼容性

docs.title: 設備運行緩慢
docs.text:
• 清理緩存
  • 移除未使用的應用程式
  • 檢查存儲空間
  • 更新系統軟件

docs.title: 模型無法保存
docs.text:
1. 檢查存儲空間
  2. 使用自動保存功能
  3. 定期導出作品
  4. 保持備份副本

docs.title: 導出問題
docs.text:
• 檢查檔案格式
  • 降低模型複雜度
  • 清理緩存
  • 更新軟件

docs.title: 支援資源
docs.text:
• 社區論壇
  • 視頻教程
  • 文檔
  • 技術支援聯繫

docs.title: 何時尋求幫助
docs.text:
• 持續崩潰
  • 數據丟失
  • 硬件故障
  • 複雜技術問題

docs.title: 評估
docs.text: 本指南提供評估STEAM項目中學生學習的策略和評分標準。

docs.title: 1. 專案式評估
docs.text:
• 最終作品評估
  • 過程記錄
  • 技術技能展示
  • 創意解難能力

docs.title: 2. 形成性評估
docs.text:
• 進度檢查點
  • 同儕評審
  • 自我反思記錄
  • 技能練習

docs.title: 3. 作品集評估
docs.text:
• 專案文檔
  • 設計迭代
  • 技術圖紙
  • 最終展示

docs.title: 技術技能 (30%)
docs.text:
• 工具熟練度
  • 軟件使用能力
  • 技術準確性
  • 安全規範遵守

docs.title: 創意過程 (30%)
docs.text:
• 構思能力
  • 設計發展
  • 解決問題
  • 創新程度

docs.title: 專案執行 (40%)
docs.text:
• 專案完成度
  • 作品質量
  • 文檔記錄
  • 作品展示

docs.title: 教材
docs.text: STEAM專案所需的完整材料和資源清單。

docs.title: 硬件
docs.text:
• 符合要求規格的電腦/平板電腦
  • 3D打印機（如適用）
  • 數碼相機/智能手機
  • 基本手工具

docs.title: 軟件
docs.text:
• 3D建模軟件（如Nomad Sculpt）
  • 圖像編輯工具
  • 專案文檔工具
  • 協作平台

docs.title: 美術用品
docs.text:
• 素描紙
  • 繪圖工具
  • 上色材料
  • 手工藝材料

docs.title: 技術材料
docs.text:
• 3D打印耗材
  • 電子元件
  • 建造材料
  • 安全設備

docs.title: 存儲解決方案
docs.text:
• 材料整理系統
  • 工具存放
  • 專案存放
  • 數碼檔案管理

docs.title: 維護
docs.text:
• 設備保養指引
  • 定期維護時間表
  • 替換零件庫存
  • 清潔用品

docs.title: 教學技巧
docs.text: 為教育工作者提供教授STEAM專案的重要指導。

docs.title: 空間設置
docs.text:
• 安排協作工作站
  • 確保工具和材料易於取用
  • 為不同活動創建指定區域
  • 保持通道暢通以確保安全

docs.title: 時間管理
docs.text:
• 為準備和清理預留緩衝時間
  • 將複雜任務分解為可管理的部分
  • 使用視覺計時器進行活動
  • 預留故障排除時間

docs.title: 專案介紹
docs.text:
1. 以引人入勝的例子開始
  2. 連結實際應用
  3. 分解複雜概念
  4. 設定明確期望

docs.title: 支援學生學習
docs.text:
• 鼓勵同儕學習
  • 提供視覺輔助
  • 使用逐步示範
  • 允許動手探索

docs.title: 因材施教
docs.text:
• 提供多個切入點
  • 提供延伸活動
  • 允許不同的學習速度
  • 支援不同的學習方式

docs.title: 技術問題
docs.text:
• 準備備用方案
  • 準備故障排除指南
  • 建立同儕支援系統
  • 記錄解決方案以供將來參考

docs.title: 學生參與
docs.text:
• 使用實際例子
  • 融入學生興趣
  • 創造協作機會
  • 慶祝進步和成就
